makers.displaydate: 1471–1528; born and died Nuremberg, Germany; active Venice, Italy, and Nuremburg
makers.displaymaker: Albrecht Dürer, 1471–1528; born and died Nuremberg, Germany; active Venice, Italy, and Nuremburg

texts.textentryhtml: Possibly Willibald Pirckheimer [1470–1530], Nuremberg; possibly by descent to his daughter Felicitas Imhoff [1497-1530] and through the Imhoff family to Hans Hieronymus Imhoff [1595- 1663]; possibly purchased by Thomas Howard, Earl of Arundel [1585–1646], in 1636 Nuremberg sale of Pirckheimer library; by descent through Henry Howard, 15th Earl of Arundel [1608-1652]to Henry Howard, 6th Duke of Norfolk [1628-1684]. Acquired by Francis Douce (1757–1834), London (possibly in London July 1806 from Thomas Philipe [?–c.1817] or from Samuel Woodburn [1786–1853]); bequeathed to the Bodleian Library, Oxford, 1834; transferred to the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, 1863 from which it was eventually deaccessioned. P. D. Colnaghi & Co., Ltd., London (stock no. C. 24726). Private collection, USA, since 1978; purchased from C.G. Boerner, New York, by Princeton University Art Museum, 2024.

geography.displaygeography: Place made: Europe, Germany, Middle Franconia, Nuremburg
